brief_summary.textblock:
Complex ventral hernia repair is a significant surgical challenge with high frequencies of
      both wound complications and recurrence. The Ventral Hernia Working Group (VHWG) described
      in 2010 recommendations regarding grading and technique of repair, which we have followed
      since November 2011.The purpose of the this study was to evaluate our results after biologic
      mesh repair of complex hernias.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biological Mesh Repair of Complex Hernias in High Risk Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
Obervational study

      Primare outcome: Surgical site occurence

      Secondary outcome: Hernia recurrence

      Biolocal mesh: Ventral hernia repair in a population with severe co-morbidity and
      contaminated hernia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Abdominal wall reconstruction with biological mesh -

        Exclusion Criteria: Pregancy,

        -

study_pop.textblock: 16 consecutive patients with biological mesh repair

clinical_study.official_title: Biological Mesh Repair of Complex Ventral Hernias in High Risk Patients

primary_outcome.description: Wound infections, redness, seromas, dehiesience at the hernia implant site

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Hernia recurrence at the hernia implant site

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
